TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant owned a house in PERSON , where he lived until DATE , when he left GPE , due to military operations in the area .
On DATE , in line with the applicable legislation , the NORP authorities gave the applicant ’s house for temporary use to P.R. and his family , refugees from GPE .
On DATE the applicant filed a request for repossession of his property with the competent administrative authority .

On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) ( “ the ORG ” ) set aside its decision of CARDINAL DATE , establishing the right of the applicant to repossess his house . In its decision , ORG established that P.R. enjoyed a right to stay in the applicant ’s house until he was provided with adequate housing by the ORG .
On DATE ORG , Reconstruction and Construction ( ORG radove , obnovu i graditeljstvo ) ( “ the Ministry ” ) issued a decision allowing the applicant to repossess his house .

On DATE the Ministry invited the applicant to contact its competent regional office in order to repossess his house and/or receive compensation for the prolonged inability to use it , in accordance with the relevant legislation .
On DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings before ORG ( PERSON ) requesting the court to order P.R. and his family to vacate his house .
On DATE ORG issued a judgment ordering P.R. to vacate the house . The defendant appealed against the judgment .
On DATE the Ministry sent a letter to the applicant with a proposal to settle the case in respect of the damage suffered by the applicant .

The Government submitted that on DATE the applicant ’s representative , PERSON , a lawyer practicing in GPE , GPE , signed a sale contract in respect of the applicant ’s house with the Agency for ORG ( Agencija za pravni promet i posredovnaje nekretninama , hereinafter “ the NORP ” ) . She received the settled price and also stated that the applicant had renounced all claims for damages in respect of the use of his house .
On DATE PERSON ) upheld the first instance judgment of DATE .
On DATE the applicant filed an application with ORG seeking enforcement of the judgment adopted by the same court and ordering the eviction of P.R.
The enforcement order was issued on DATE .

However , on DATE the applicant ’s representative , PERSON , a lawyer practicing in PERSON , withdrew the application for an enforcement order stating that the applicant had no further interest in pursuing these proceedings and therefore sought that the proceedings be terminated .
The applicant states that the above sale contract of DATE was signed without his knowledge or consent . However , he did not dispute that he himself had hired PERSON as his legal representative .
On DATE the ORG filed a criminal complaint with ORG ( Općinsko državno odvjetništvo u PERSON ) stating that the power of attorney presented by PERSON was falsified .
On an unspecified date the applicant left GPE allegedly because he had received death threats . He moved to GPE .

Section CARDINAL of LAW ( Zakon o privremenom preuzimanju i upravljanju određenom imovinom , ORG nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL ) provides that property , situated in the previously occupied territories and belonging to persons who had left GPE , should be in the possession and under the control of the ORG .

The relevant part of LAW of the Temporary Takeover and ORG ( Zakon o prestanku važenja PERSON o privremenom preuzimanju i upravljanu određenom imovinom , Official PERSON ) provides that persons , whose property was given to others for accommodation during their absence from GPE , are to file a request for repossession of their property with the competent local authority .

The LAW on the Areas of Special State Care ( Zakon o područjima od posebne državne skrbi , ORG nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL ( correction ) , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL ( correction ) , CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( consolidated text ) ) , as amended by DATE LAW , provides as relevant :
Sections CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL provide that a temporary occupant has the right to housing .

Section CARDINAL provides that the Ministry shall compensate the damage suffered by the owner who has submitted a request for repossession of his property prior to DATE but to whom the property has not been returned by DATE .
